title: Mass of LiOH needed to absorb CO2 astronaut -calc

content.question:
<math alttext="C O 2, gas, plus 2 L i O H, solid, react to produce L i 2 C O 3, aqueous, plus H 2 O, liquid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.1em"></mspace><mtext>LiOH</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>Li</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

In a one-person spacecraft, an astronaut exhales <math alttext="967 grams " overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>967</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>g</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> of <math alttext="C O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> (molar mass <math alttext="44 grams per mole " overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>44.01</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>g</mtext> <mo>/</mo> <mtext>mol</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>) per day. To prevent the buildup of <math alttext="C O 2, gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> in the spacecraft, a device containing <math alttext="L i O H, solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LiOH</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is used to remove the <math alttext="C O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, as represented by the equation above. What mass of <math alttext="L i O H, solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LiOH</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> (molar mass <math alttext="23.95 grams per mole " overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>23.95</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>g</mtext> <mo>/</mo> <mtext>mol</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>) is needed to react with all of the <math alttext="C O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> produced by an astronaut in one day

choices.label: <math alttext="43.9 grams" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>43.9</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>g</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>
<math alttext="263 grams" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>263</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>g</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>
<math alttext="526 grams" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>526</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>g</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>
<math alttext="1050 grams" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>1050</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>g</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1050 grams" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>1050</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>g</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
